poem:
The Silent Stage

Voices rise like smoke,  
yet the airwaves are barren.  
Chords of dissent tremble  
unheard in our ears.  
Echoes of truth, now  
caged, seek release  
in a world afraid  
of its own reflection,  
where silence  
dances on strings,  
plucking at the heart  
of what fears to be  
revealed,  
alive.
